Administration has been closely monitoring the possibility of severe weather from Hurricane Laura. The latest update from the Office of Emergency Management early this morning shows the time for the storm’s arrival in our area moved to earlier in the afternoon than expected in previous predictions.

Due to the possibility of severe weather, school will dismiss at 1:00 today.

We ask parents to watch for messaging about the status of tomorrow (Friday). Current predictions indicate that the severe weather will have moved out by tomorrow; however, if there are power outages, flooding, and/or road closures, we will have a remote learning day. Please check email, social media platforms, app and/or our website for updates.

Today, teachers will provide students with assignments for tomorrow in the event a remote learning day is needed. Teachers will provide paper assignments for those students who do not have internet access or devices.

Again, a decision has not been made about tomorrow. We just want parents to be aware in case arrangements need to be made for childcare.

Bryant Public Schools is pleased to announce that Dexter Barksdale has been named the new Assistant Principal for Bryant High School.

As an alumni of the Bryant School District, Mr. Barksdale is a Hornet to his core.

Coming back to his hometown roots in 2017, he continued his teaching tenure as a biology and chemistry teacher. In 2018, he transitioned into the engineering department. Last year he served as an associate grant writer for a $40,000 grant which funded the Unmanned Aerial courses offered at BHS.

Growing in his leadership capacity, Mr. Barksdale assisted in the development of the academy model at the high school under the capacity of STEM House Leader.

Mr. Barksdale believes in the OneTeam mentality of the Bryant Schools, and has thoroughly enjoyed beginning each morning as a bus driver with the Transportation Department while ensuring that students safely arrive at school. He aims to continue his impact at BHS through the lens of an administrator while bringing his knowledge and expertise of the STEM and CTE departments to the table. Bryant High School

Add a pandemic to the mix. Bryant’s Child Nutrition staff members have selflessly gone above and beyond to make sure that children continue to receive healthy meals during the school closure. Superheroes come in many forms and do not always wear capes…sometimes they wear masks, gloves & aprons. We say ‘thank you’ for bravely working to serve others. You are inspiring!

Mr. Craig Leone joined the Bryant School Board in March, representing At Large Zone A. He is originally from Mansfield, Louisiana and is a graduate of Louisiana Tech.

In 2013, he and his wife, Michele, daughter Jordan and son Jaxon moved from Little Rock to the Bryant community. He works as a Project Manager/Civil Engineer at Garver. He is an active member of Geyer Springs First Baptist Church where he volunteers in community outreach programs.

Mr. Leone enjoys spending time with family, traveling, and pursing hobbies in photography, history, reading, computers/technology, and geocaching.

As a Bryant School Board member, Mr. Leone’s goal is to use his experience as an engineer, father, and volunteer to help continue the legacy of Bryant as an innovator in the education community and as a student-first district.

We welcome him to the Board and and thank him for his service to our community. #Teamof7

Athletic and extracurricular teams have been preparing for out of state competitions over the next month (including Spring Break). Our teams have worked hard to excel at the state level and earn the opportunity to compete in a broader arena. Because student and staff safety is our highest priority, we must evaluate and make the best decisions to do what is necessary to limit exposure to COVID-19.

Late yesterday, we received updated guidance from ADH & ADE regarding COVID-19, and we have been discussing the upcoming out of state travel for our teams/groups. We must do all we can to limit exposure to the virus. Rather than risk the health of our students and staff, we have decided to CANCEL ALL OUT OF STATE TRAVEL until further notice. At this time, other in state activities will continue.

We know this decision may be disappointing to our staff, students, and parents. Based on the information we have at this time, we believe this to be the best choice for our Hornet family.
